body_html:
Hi @JafferWilson,

I might missed the particular statement. 'GPU Model and memory' is to specify GPU Model used in your computer and VRAM available in the particular GPU instead of the availability of nnModel. Can I have a look on the testing results and training results? You are running in a python notebook right?

Thanks,
Alan Lam

body:
Hi @JafferWilson,

I might missed the particular statement. 'GPU Model and memory' is to specify GPU Model used in your computer and VRAM available in the particular GPU instead of the availability of nnModel. Can I have a look on the testing results and training results? You are running in a python notebook right?

Thanks,
Alan Lam
